alert.note: Alert for Cook; DuPage; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 20 at 6:28PM CDT until April 20 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Will County in northeastern Illinois... Southeastern DuPage County in northeastern Illinois... Eastern Cook County in northeastern Illinois... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 628 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Channahon, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Chicago, Joliet, Cicero, Hammond, Bolingbrook, Orland Park, Tinley Park, Oak Lawn, Berwyn, Oak Park, Downers Grove, Romeoville, Plainfield, Calumet City, Woodridge, West Town, Chicago Lawn, Englewood, Austin and South Shore. Including the following interstates... I-55 between mile markers 249 and 294. I-57 between mile markers 343 and 358. I-80 between mile markers 124 and 155. I-90 between mile markers 101 and 107. I-94 between mile markers 43 and 70. I-290 between mile markers 18 and 29. I-294 between mile markers 43 and 70. I-355 between mile markers 1 and 15. Indiana I-90 between mile markers 1 and 2. This includes... Argonne National Laboratory, Brookfield Zoo, Lincoln Park Zoo, Loyola University, SeatGeek Stadium, University of Chicago, University of St. Francis, Windy City Thunderbolts Baseball, Chicagoland Speedway...Route 66 Raceway, Hollywood Casino Amphitheatre, Hawthorne Park, Joliet Junior College, Joliet Slammers Baseball, Lewis University, Moraine Valley Community College, Northeastern Illinois University, Soldier Field, University of Illinois Chicago, Guaranteed Rate Field...IL Institute of Technology, Wrigley Field, The Loop, Museum of Science and Industry, Museum Campus, and Northerly Island. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northeastern Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northeastern Illinois.
